verses.roman:
kibā mora kathāya mane bhrama hañā gela!
kibā kona jantu āsi' sakala khāila?

synonyms: kibā—or; mora kathāya—when I was thinking like that; mane—in the mind; bhrama hañā gela—I was mistaken; kibā—or; kona jantu—some animal; āsi'-coming; sakala khāila—ate everything.
translation: "She began to wonder whether there was actually anything on the plate in the first place. Then again she thought that some animal might have come and eaten everything.
